intro: Cynoglossum karamojense, commonly known as the Karamojian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to East Africa, particularly Uganda. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers, which are typically arranged in a raceme. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and cultural significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
